Title:
Hygrophorus yukishiro sp. nov., a new vernal edible mushroom
from Shinshu region, Japan
Keywords:
Basidiomycota, Edible mushroom, Taxonomy, Vernal fruiting,
“Yuki-wari”
Abstract:
A novel basidiomycetous species, Hygrophorus yukishiro is
described from Japan. Fruit-bodies of this fungus have been called as
“Yuki-shiro”, “Yuki-take”, or “Yuki-wari” and utilized as an edible
mushroom for local people in the central region of Nagano, Japan.
Hygrophorus yukishiro fruits in the early spring season under
oak-dominated stands. Morphological observation and phylogenetic
analysis of internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region of nuclear
ribosomal RNA (rRNA) gene indicated that H. yukishiro is the sister
species of H. arbustivus and belongs to section Hygrophorus, subsect.
Fulventes. Hygrophorus yukishiro is similar to H. roseobrunneus, H.
leucophaeo-ilicis and H. roseodiscoideus in their external morphology
and fruiting phenology, but distinguished form them in the color and
texture of pileus surface and microscopic characteristics.
